page.title: 18The Tendring Hundred Show
page.content: A large open-air exhibition comprising the latest agricultural machinary, trade stands and items reflecting life and pursuits in this area is held in Lawford in July. Tendring is the name given to the district extending from Gt. Bromley (and surrounding villages) to Clacton and Harwich. Lawford is a fairly central site for the show which attracts many visitors and has a social attraction for people from all walks of life, not just the farming community. (The term "Hundred" is medieval in origin and denotes an administrative district).This show is typical of the annual agricultural shows which provide the social highlight of the county calender in East Anglia. The Royal Norfolk Show, the Suffolk Show and the Essex Show are more major examples. By Mr.J.Bloom, Teacher.
